content.title: Scholarship For Differently Abled Students
content.details: The scheme 'Scholarship for Differently Abled Students' was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. Under the scheme, the differently abled students studying in Schools, Colleges, and those who attend Professional, PG courses and technical training are being given scholarships by Social Justice Department. The disability category of students (Blind/Deaf/Orthopedically handicapped/Mental Retardation) with a disability of 40% or more and who obtain 40% marks in the examination in the previous year are eligible to apply for the scholarships.
benefits: ₹300/- per month for Students from Class 1 to Class 4
₹500/- per month for Students from Class 5 to Class 10
₹750/- per month for +1, +2, IT Equivalent courses
₹1000/- per month for Degree, Polytechnic, Equivalent training courses
₹1000/- per month for Professional, PG courses
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala.
The applicant should be a differently abled student.
The differently abled student should have a disability of 40 % or more.
Disability category of students (Blind / Deaf / Orthopedically handicapped/ Mental Retardation).
The differently abled students studying in Schools, Colleges and attending Professional, PG courses and technical training are eligible to apply under the scheme.
Students with disabilities who have secured at least 40% marks in the previous year can apply under the scheme.
The annual family income of the applicant should be below ₹36,000/-.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Registration Process involves visiting the SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal, registering, and then applying through the portal.
documents_required: Disability certificate from Medical board/Disability Identity card
Bank details- Copy of Pass Book

faqs.question: What is the 'Scholarship For Differently Abled Students' Scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the differently abled students studying in Schools, Colleges, and those who attend Professional, PG courses and technical training are being given scholarships by Social Justice Department.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The differently abled students studying in Schools, Colleges and attending Professional, PG courses and technical training are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What should be the minimum percentage of marks required to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students with disabilities who have secured at least 40% marks in the previous year can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for differently abled students?
faqs.answer: Yes, only students with disability are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What should be the disability percentage of the students applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The differently abled student should have a disability of 40 % or more.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: Which type of disability student is eligible to apply in this scheme?
faqs.answer: The disability of students should be Blind / Deaf / Orthopedically handicapped/ Mental Retardation to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the scholarship is being provided to students of class 1st to Post-Graduation whose disability percentage is 40% or above @ ₹300/- per month to ₹1500/- per month as per the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Is there any criterion for annual family income?
faqs.answer: Yes, the annual family income of the applicant should be below ₹36,000/-.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal- SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.

faqs.question: In how many days should the applicant submit the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form must be submitted after the commencement of the Academic year (within 3 months).
